;新加坡处决了一名因贩运海洛因而被定罪的 39 岁男子，当局周四表示，该国今年发生了第五起绞刑，也是一周多以来的第三起绞刑。

;

;穆罕默德·沙勒·阿杜尔·拉蒂夫 (Mohamed Shalleh Adul Latiff) 因 2019 年“以贩运为目的”持有约 55 克海洛因而被判处死刑。

;

;中央肃毒局（CNB）在一份声明中称，他的处罚已于周四执行。

;

;根据法庭文件，穆罕默德·沙勒在被捕前曾担任送货司机。 2016 年。在审判期间，他声称相信自己正在为欠钱的朋友运送走私香烟。

;

;他成为自 2022 年 3 月政府恢复处决以来第 16 名被送上绞刑架的囚犯在 Covid-19 大流行期间暂停了两年之后。

;

;2022 年，新加坡执行了 11 起绞刑，创下了全球死刑执行记录。

;

;此次处决距离新加坡执行死刑不到一周尽管遭到人权组织的谴责，但还是近 20 年来第一位因贩毒而被捕的女性。

;

;45 岁的新加坡人 Saridewi Binte Djamani 因贩运约 30 克海洛因而于周五被处决。

;< p>;一名 57 岁的当地男子 Mohd Aziz bin Hussain 两天前因贩运约 50 克海洛因而被绞死。

;

;联合国上周谴责了绞刑，并呼吁新加坡暂停执行绞刑。死刑。

;

;尽管国际社会对这个问题的压力越来越大，但新加坡坚持认为死刑是对贩毒的有效威慑。

;

;这个富裕的金融中心拥有一些世界上最严厉的国家禁毒法 – 贩运超过 500 克大麻或超过 15 克海洛因可能会导致死刑。

;香港警方在打击一个卖淫集团的行动中逮捕了四名妇女。来自中国大陆的性工作者到九龙市中心的妓院工作。

;

;周三晚上，警方突击搜查位于九龙市中心一栋大楼的三家妓院时，逮捕了四名嫌疑人——一名当地妇女和三名来自大陆的游客。警方周四表示，位于旺角弥敦道。

;

;警方表示，“初步调查显示，这名 44 岁的香港女子据称是该犯罪团伙的核心成员。”

;

;她因涉嫌以卖淫为目的控制妇女和经营色情场所而被拘留。

;

;香港警方追捕两名涉嫌在承诺按摩后抢劫老年男子的人

;

;警方逮捕了三人大陆人，所有年龄在 25 岁至 42 岁之间的女性，因违反逗留条件而被逮捕。

;

;在代号为“Stempicker”的行动中，警方缴获了约 10,000 港元（1,282 美元），以及避孕套和避孕套等物品。几瓶按摩油。

;

;截至周四上午，嫌疑人仍被警方拘留。旺角特勤队人员正在跟进案件。

;

;在香港，根据《刑事罪行条例》，开设卖淫场所可被判处最高 10 年监禁。

;

;上个月，警方针对位于庙街油麻地地区的另一个卖淫团伙经营的妓院，逮捕了两名分别为 15 岁和 16 岁的内地姐妹。

;

;两人是七名来自内地的旅客之一。泰国在扫黄行动中被捕。警方还抓获了涉嫌犯罪的头目——一名 55 岁的女性——和她的男助手。

;

;警方数据显示，今年 1 月至 3 月期间，有 499 名旅客因涉嫌犯下各种罪行而被拘留，其中 3 名旅客因涉嫌犯罪而被拘留。比去年第一季度抓获的 165 名游客多出一倍。

;

;尖沙咀酒店打击性爱团伙，香港 16 名女性被拘留

;

;超过一半，即 266 名被捕的499人中，来自内地，比去年同期的37人增加了六倍。

;

;因各种犯罪而被捕的其他国家的游客人数也增加了82%今年前三个月，游客数量从 2022 年同期的 128 人增加到 233 人。

;

;警方发言人 6 月份告诉《华盛顿邮报》，今年第一季度因犯罪被捕的游客人数今年有所增加，但仍较疫情前同期为低。

;

;警队会密切留意事态发展，适时采取适当行动，包括加强各地区的巡逻、他说，开展有针对性的情报主导行动并促进犯罪预防。

;在一位配音演员公开反对后，《芭比娃娃》的日本上映遭遇了更多挫折。这部热门电影引发争议的草根营销运动，美国大使也因在网上宣传该电影而受到严厉批评。

;

;由玛格特·罗比主演的《芭比娃娃》最近的全球票房收入达到 8 亿美元，为这部影片提供了帮助部分原因是病毒式传播的“巴本海默”模因，该模因将这部电影与同时上映的核弹科学家 J. 罗伯特·奥本海默的传记片配对。

;

;芭比制片人华纳兄弟最初关注的是粉丝制作的模因描绘了罗比的芭比娃娃和演员希里安·墨菲的奥本海默，以及核爆炸的图像。

;

;“巴本海默”在社交媒体上很受欢迎，日本对此并不满意

;

;但粉丝们并不高兴这在日本很有趣，未来几天将纪念 78 年前的广岛和长崎原子弹爆炸。

;

;#NoBarbenheimer 标签在网上流行，促使华纳的日本部门罕见地公开批评其公司母公司随后于本周道歉。

;

;在日文版本中为芭比娃娃配音的高畠光希周三在 Instagram 上发帖称，她对模因营销活动感到沮丧，并考虑放弃8 月 11 日在东京举行的一场宣传活动，宣传其开幕。

;

;“这件事真的非常令人失望，”她发帖说。

;

;精通媒体的美国驻日本大使拉姆伊曼纽尔贴出了一张与导演格蕾塔·葛韦格会面的照片，但网上反应冷淡。

;

;“你此时的帖子会让许多日本人感到紧张，并将进一步坚定他们永远不去的决心。” X 平台（以前称为 Twitter）上一位名为 tsuredzure 的发帖者回复道：“去看那部电影吧。” p>;

;这部电影因在很大程度上忽视了二战末期该武器在日本的破坏情况而受到批评，该武器摧毁了两个主要城市并造成超过 20 万人死亡。

; Thu, 03 Aug 2023 12:50:02 +0800 Should Trump go to jail? The 2024 election could become a referendum on that questionhttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/united-states-canada/article/3229820/should-trump-go-jail-2024-election-could-become-referendum-question?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.03 12:43;
;;

;2024 年大选将决定唐纳德·特朗普是否重返白宫。它还可能决定他是否会面临牢狱之灾。

;

;特朗普现在被第三次刑事起诉，这次是因为他试图推翻 2020 年选举并阻止总统权力移交，他赢得了胜利不仅仅是关于自我、救赎、算计或国家的未来。

;

;“这次选举很可能关乎唐纳德·特朗普的个人自由，”长期共和党策略师阿里·弗莱舍(Ari Fleischer)表示。 “毫不夸张地说，如果被定罪，他可能会被判入狱，除非他获胜并且他利用正义的杠杆来扭转、阻止或放弃它。”

;

;特朗普为已经是现代历史上任何一次选举的选举增添了新的内容。现在，这不仅是一场关于国家挑战的辩论，也是一场关于这位 77 岁的前总统和共和党领跑者是否应该入狱的党派之争。

;

;特朗普将这个问题摆在了首位。盟友国会女议员马乔里·泰勒·格林在推特上表示，“即使特朗普入狱，她仍然会投票给他”。

;

;批评者长期以来一直声称，特朗普对起诉的恐惧是他决定再次竞选的主要动机。尽管特朗普否认这一点 — — 坚称如果他决定不竞选，就不会提出指控 — — 但新的起诉书确保了他的竞选和法律问题现在相互交织在一起。

;

;在 2020 年大选中受到联邦指控后，特朗普面临更多法律困境调查

;

;“法律信息就是政治信息，政治信息就是法律信息，”特朗普竞选发言人史蒂文·张(Steven Cheung)在谈到新现实时表示。 “这是我们正在运行的一部分。特朗普已将法律问题作为其竞选活动的一大焦点，从我们的角度来看，这是有效的信息传递。”

;

;针对特朗普的 78 项州和联邦指控已经在他的巡回演讲中占据主导地位，因为他试图描绘他本人是政治化司法部的受害者，司法部一心损害乔·拜登总统的主要政治对手的前景。在集会上，他试图将这些指控描述为不仅是对他的攻击，也是对他的支持者的攻击。<​​/p>;

;“他们不是在起诉我，而是在起诉你们，”他在集会上对人群说。周末在宾夕法尼亚州伊利举行的集会。

;

;在更实际的层面上，特朗普面临着前所未有的平衡行为，在竞选的同时面临至少三个不同司法管辖区可能的审判。

;

;他将出现周四在华盛顿联邦法院面临最新指控，然后在周五参加阿拉巴马州共和党晚宴。

;

;特别检察官杰克·史密斯在佛罗里达州对他提出了额外的刑事指控，下周他将在佛罗里达州面临另一次传讯。案件与他处理机密文件有关。这将发生在新罕布什尔州的竞选停留和可能的爱荷华州博览会之间。

;

;特朗普还可能在亚特兰大面临与推翻佐治亚州 2020 年选举结果相关的新指控，并且必须还决定是否参加8月23日的首场共和党总统辩论。

;

;特朗普竞选官员表示，他们并不担心此类后勤挑战。

;

;“特朗普总统的竞选活动不会受到影响特朗普高级竞选顾问杰森·米勒表示，“无论他们多么努力，深层政府都在努力干预选举。”他和其他人一样认为，特朗普和他的团队在防守方面训练有素。

;

;张指出，迄今为止，没有任何竞选活动因法律程序而被重新安排或取消，而且，如果有的话，也增加了更多的站点。

;

;起诉可能会推动特朗普更接近 2024 年提名

;

;“一切都在全速前进，”他在最新起诉书之前说道。

;

;但特朗普面临的挑战超出了政治范围。针对他的每起案件——从佛罗里达州的机密文件案到纽约向女性支付不当封口费的指控以及周二公布的起诉书——都需要紧张的准备。

;

;“显然， “一般情况下，不可能一次准备多于一项刑事审判，”著名白领刑事辩护律师巴里·博斯(Barry Boss)说。 “通常这本身就是压倒性的。因此，对我来说，面临多项起诉的想法是不可想象的。”

;

;一般来说，规则要求联邦案件中的被告必须出席重大事件，例如首次出庭和判决时出庭。回来了，但给他们留有余地来决定何时出现。

;

;“有些人非常热衷于他们的辩护，每天都想与你交谈，而另一些人则将其留给你博斯说。

;

;调查也主导了特朗普的竞选支出。美联社分析发现，今年到目前为止，这位前总统的政治运作在为他、他的幕僚和盟友辩护的法律费用上花费的费用比旅行、集会和其他竞选费用的总和还多。

;

;根据司法准则，现任总统通常不会受到起诉和刑事起诉。但赢回白宫并不能无限期地保护特朗普。

;

;特朗普面临哪些选举干预指控？

;

;如果他再次当选，他可以指示司法部长解雇联邦检察官案件、解雇检察官或通过试图赦免自己来测试总统权力的极限。但这些努力仅适用于联邦案件，不适用于他在纽约面临或可能在佐治亚州面临的州刑事指控。

;

;即使特朗普最终没有成为提名人，另一位共和党总统也可能会这样做面临着来自特朗普的巨大压力，要求其撤销指控以安抚他的支持者——自从杰拉尔德·福特赦免他的前任理查德·尼克松在水门事件中犯下的罪行以来，没有哪位总统面临过这种压力。

;

;总而言之，“这是非同寻常的”坏消息和国际影响将是毁灭性的。这就是为什么人们需要清醒过来，”特朗普的前国家安全顾问、现任批评家约翰·博尔顿说，他认为现实加大了共和党寻找替代候选人的压力。 “最好有人主动出击，说我们正在走向悬崖边缘。”

;

;但到目前为止，特朗普的起诉几乎没有面临什么政治影响，他对共和党挑战者的巨大领先优势甚至还在扩大。他们很难做出回应。与此同时，他利用入狱的可能性来筹集现金。

;

;他在最近的一封筹款电子邮件中抱怨说，“‘司法部’正试图将我关进监狱”我的余生都是一个无辜的人”。其他主题为“关于：入狱 400 年”的征集活动也已到来。

;

;弗莱舍表示，选民将开始通过竞选活动的视角来看待特朗普在法律上的胜利和失败。

;

;例如，如果一个案件中的指控被驳回，“就好像他赢得了这场合法的初选”，如果法官做出不利于他的裁决，“人们会觉得他在法庭初选的第一天就输了”。

;

;弗莱舍说，如果特朗普最终不得不在法庭上花费大量时间，他可以想象这位前总统在法院台阶上大声讲话，告诉在家观看的选民，“我不是在受审，你们是在受审”。受审。我在法庭上为你而战”。

;

;“这可以让他远离道路，但他只是有另一个平台可以让他的声音被听到。对他来说，这只是一场战役。”

; Thu, 03 Aug 2023 12:50:02 +0800 Niger’s new military ruler warns against foreign meddling, urges population to defend the countryhttps://www.scmp.com/news/world/africa/article/3229815/nigers-new-military-ruler-warns-against-foreign-meddling-urges-population-defend-country?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.03 11:50;
;;

;尼日尔新军事统治者在全国电视转播中猛烈抨击邻国和国际社会周三晚上发表讲话，他呼吁民众做好保卫国家的准备。

;

;这是自一周前从尼日尔民选总统手中夺取权力以来向​​这个西非国家发表的为数不多的讲话之一，阿卜杜拉赫马内·奇亚尼 (Abdourahmane Tchiani) 将军警告不要外国干预和军事干预政变。

;

;“因此，我们呼吁全体尼日尔人民和他们的团结，击败所有那些想要给我们辛勤工作的人民和人民造成难以形容的痛苦的人。”破坏我们国家的稳定。”Tchiani 说道。

;

;指挥尼日尔总统卫队的 Tchiani 还承诺，在总统穆罕默德·巴祖姆 (Mohamed Bazoum) 下台后，为和平过渡到选举创造条件。

;

;他发表讲话之际，地区紧张局势不断升级，西非地区集团西非经共体威胁称，如果巴祖姆在 8 月 6 日之前不解除软禁并恢复职务，将使用武力。该集团实施了严厉的旅行和经济制裁。

;;

;尼日尔政变：西非集团威胁使用武力会是什么样子？

;

;法国在尼日尔驻有1,500名士兵与尼日尔军队开展联合行动，美国和其他欧洲国家也帮助训练了该国的军队。

;

;Tchiani 表示，尼日尔未来面临困难时期，这些人的“敌对和激进”态度反对他的统治的人不会提供任何附加价值。他称西非国家经济共同体实施的制裁是非法、不公平、不人道和史无前例的。

;

;在法国、意大利和西班牙宣布撤离其公民和其他欧洲人之后，第四架法国军事撤离飞机离开尼日尔。由于担心可能被困，他们在尼亚美撤离。

;

;法国外交部称，近 1,000 人已搭乘四趟航班离开，第五次疏散正在进行中。

;

;意大利军方意大利国防部称，这架飞机周三降落在罗马，机上载有 99 名乘客，其中包括 21 名美国人和来自其他国家的平民。意大利外交部长安东尼奥·塔亚尼表示，这些航班是在尼日尔新政府的许可下进行的。

;

;美国国务院周三下令非必要的使馆工作人员和一些家庭成员暂时离开尼日尔作为预防措施。它表示其大使馆将保持开放。一些美国公民已经在欧洲人的帮助下离开。

;

;西非经共体集团国防部长会议周三在尼日利亚首都开幕，商讨下一步行动。欧盟政治事务、和平与稳定专员阿卜杜勒-法陶·穆萨表示，阿布贾会议将讨论如何“与我们在尼日尔共和国发现的人质事件中的官员进行谈判”。

;

;西非经共体周日宣布的制裁包括停止与尼日尔的能源交易，根据国际可再生​​能源机构的数据，尼日尔高达 90% 的电力来自邻国尼日利亚。

;

;埃里克·菲奥 (Eric Fior)，一门私人语言的法国人东京附近横滨市的一所学校表示，日本对死记硬背的强调是有​​害的。

;“现在大多数学校英语课都有以英语为母语的人，这是积极的，因为这是学生倾听和学习的最佳方式说这种语言，”他说。

; Thu, 03 Aug 2023 11:20:02 +0800 China’s household debt creeps upward, approaching warning line of International Monetary Fundhttps://www.scmp.com/economy/china-economy/article/3229755/chinas-household-debt-creeps-upward-approaching-warning-line-international-monetary-fund?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.03 11:00;
;;

;Chinese households have reported rising indebtedness while still trying to shake off the ghosts of uncertainties in jobs and incomes, contributing to the nation's economic slowdown and raising questions about whether Beijing's new consumption push can actually loosen up shoppers' purse strings.

;

;Analysts appear more worried about consumers' genuine spending ability, as their income growth has lagged behind economic expansion and they become more inclined to save for mortgage payments, utility bills, childrearing and their own uncertain future.

;

;The nation's household debt reached 63.5 per cent of the national gross domestic product (GDP) in the second quarter, up from 61.9 per cent at the end of last year, according to a report by the National Institution for Finance and Development (NIFD) issued on July 23.

;

;It is getting closer to the 65 per cent red line previously used by the International Monetary Fund as a warning point about financial risks.

;

;As China's debt risks mount, the spectre of looming local crises rears its head

;

;China's household debt is mainly in the form of mortgage loans, which reached 38.6 trillion yuan (US$5.38 trillion) by the end of June; as well as consumer goods loans, credit card debt, private borrowings, and loans used to fund business operations.

;

;“The effective demand for both household consumption and investment fell,” wrote Zhang Xiaojing and Liu Lei, two researchers with the Beijing-based think tank.

;

;Zhang is also a government adviser heading the Institute of Finance and Banking at the Chinese Academy of Social Sciences.

;

;“The weak household spending was mainly owing to their slow growth of income and eventually the slow economic growth,” they said.

;

;China has seen a fast rise in its household leverage ratio since 2008, when Beijing's policymakers launched a 4-trillion-yuan stimulus package and monetary loosening to counter the financial crisis.

;

;The end-2008 leverage ratio was only 17.9 per cent.

;

;The Bank for International Settlements estimated that the debt of Chinese households reached US$10.76 trillion by the end of last year, or 61.3 per cent of its economic output.

;

;This has already surpassed 55.2 per cent seen in Germany by end-2022, 36.4 per cent in India, and 47.7 per cent for the average of emerging economies, and China is now fast approaching the leverage ratio of 74.4 per cent in the United States and 68.2 per cent in Japan.

;

;Excessive levels of indebtedness and slow income growth among Chinese residents are constraining consumption, but for now China's Politburo is relying more on domestic demand to drive up the national growth, based on sentiment expressed at its quarterly conference last week.

;

;The National Development and Reform Commission also rolled out 20 consumer-stimulus measures earlier this week, loosening purchasing restrictions on automobiles and property sales while vowing to improve the nation's consumption environment.

;

;Consumption contributed to 32.8 per cent of China's GDP growth in 2022, down from 58.3 per cent in 2021, as market entities and households were heavily affected by zero-Covid controls.

;

;China's not 'turning the corner', and economic hope hinges on help from Beijing

;

;In the second quarter of this year, consumption drove 77.2 per cent of the growth amid the Covid reopening.

;

;Although Chinese residents' savings grew by 12 trillion yuan in the first half of this year – or 67 per cent of the full-year growth in 2022 – the NIFD report attributed this to a rise in private financing and the temporary suspension of financial deleveraging.

;

;Given the debt stress, residents are more likely to use their savings to pay off debt to reduce asset risks than to consume and invest, due to their “more pessimistic expectations of future economic growth”, it said.

;

;In a research note released on Tuesday, the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) warned that Beijing's boost of property and big-budget consumption could have limited effectiveness because it lacks decisive action such as household-focused fiscal transfers.

;

;Consumers in China remain cautious due to their widespread uncertainty over future wage and employment opportunities, which may further drag down the country's economic momentum, it added.

;

;As Chinese households are repairing their balance sheets – a result of the three-year pandemic – many have increased their savings and also focused on repaying existing mortgage loans with higher interest rates than newer loans.

;

;China's outstanding mortgage loans dropped 0.8 per cent in the second quarter from a year earlier – the first decline in more than a decade, government data shows.

;

;Empirical evidence also indicates that the decline in housing purchases may induce a further drop in sales of other big-ticket products, including home appliances, decorating materials, and automobiles.

;

;Despite property assets shrinking, the NIFD said China is currently not in a balance-sheet recession, which has haunted Japan.

;

;Are China's houses for speculating? Beijing lets real estate off leash

;

;However, if Beijing allows the private sector to repair the debt on its own, residents may further cut back on consumption and investment to pay off the debt, further reducing corporate earnings, which in turn reduces employment opportunities and incomes for residents as well as government tax revenue.

;

;The think tank suggested that Beijing should increase its debt issuance while cutting interest rates more sharply to reduce interest payments on its huge stock of debt.

;

;China's total real-economy debt was about 380 trillion yuan, or 283.9 per cent of the national GDP, by the end of June, up from 273.1 per cent since late 2022.

;

;An interest-rate cut of just 1 percentage point would reduce interest payments by almost 4 trillion yuan, which would significantly lift China's sagging economy, it said.

;China's loss in India could be Elon Musk's gain.

;

;Tesla has had a red-carpet welcome from India for its proposal to invest in the country, while its largest rival in electric vehicles, China's BYD, has been stopped cold by increased scrutiny from New Delhi.

;

;The result could be an opening for Tesla to negotiate terms for an entry to the world's third-largest auto market without the competitive threat from BYD that it faces in other emerging markets, like Thailand.

;

;“The future of who wins in India will have some bearing on who wins globally in the EV race,” said Jasmeet Khurana of the World Economic Forum.

;

;Since a meeting between Musk and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi in June in New York, Tesla has fast-tracked closed-door discussions with Indian officials on a potential plant investment and plans to build a new low-cost US$24,000 EV.

;

;

;Those talks continued over the past week with Tesla discussing minute details of its plans to gain access to India's fast-growing EV market, and Modi personally tracking developments, sources say.

;

;Those meetings, though, have been strictly kept under wraps, with officials putting out no photos on social media of handshakes with executives which otherwise is a usual affair after high-profile meetings.

;

;BYD, meanwhile, appears to be taking a back seat.据路透社报道，在为自己在印度的 10 亿美元投资寻求批准几个月后，比亚迪不再热衷于寻求批准。 In a further setback, BYD is facing an investigation over allegations that it underpaid import tax in India.

;

;Among other concerns, Indian officials are worried about the national security implications of Chinese-made vehicles and the data they could collect. India is “uncomfortable with Chinese carmakers,” an official said.

;

;While all investments from China have faced tightened approval requirements in India since a border clash between the two in 2020, there could be an outsize effect on the developing market for EVs in India because of China's dominance in battery materials, battery production and other technology.

;

;Tesla, too, has Chinese suppliers that have helped it slash production costs at its Shanghai factory and it now wants to bring them to India – where it appears to have an upper hand in talks with New Delhi.

;

;India has told Tesla it will allow its Chinese suppliers into the country if they forge partnerships with local firms, just like Apple did. But at the same time, India is hesitant on BYD's US$1-billion plan even though that too was proposed as a partnership with a domestic engineering firm.

;

;The Global Times, a Chinese state-run newspaper, said the reported pushback on BYD's investment plan “will lead to a chain reaction and deal a blow to the overall confidence of Chinese companies in investing India.”

;

;BYD did not respond to requests for comment on the status of its India investment plan or the import tax claim. In a statement, the company noted it had been active in the Indian market for 16 years and sells commercial vehicles and passenger cars there.

;

;

;Tesla did not respond to a request for comment on its talks with Indian officials. Musk had said in June that Modi was “pushing us to make significant investments in India, which is something we intend to do.”

;

;Tesla wants to sell 20 million cars globally by 2030, up from 1.31 million in 2022, but faces hurdles to expanding its Shanghai factory.

;

;BYD was the world's biggest seller of EVs and plug-in hybrids in 2022 with a total of 1.86 million units – the vast majority in China. It trails Tesla in terms of sales of fully electric cars.

;

;“Tesla sees competition mainly with BYD, and both are expanding globally at great speed,” said Gaurav Vangaal of S&P Global Mobility.

;

;“If they want volumes, they have to come to India,” he said, adding that with the government incentivising companies to build EVs locally, India can also serve as an export base.

;

;Annual production of light electric vehicles in India is expected to rise to 1.4 million by 2030, close to 19 per cent of total forecast production of 7.25 million, according to estimates by S&P Global Mobility. It was less than 50,000 in 2022.

;

;India's nascent EV market is dominated by local player Tata Motors, whose bestselling Nexon EV sells for as high as US$19,000 while Chinese carmaker MG Motor's ZS EV starts at US$28,000 while BYD's Atto 3 retails at around US$41,000 in India.

;

;Toyota Motor, Hyundai Motor and Kia all sell mid-sized petrol SUVs priced at around US$24,000, Tesla's identified entry point.

;

;Tesla does not currently sell vehicles in India.

;

;“Tesla has become a desirable product in name alone,” said Sam Fiorani of AutoForecast Solutions. “Add to that an affordable product tailored for the Indian market and it has the potential to be a hit locally.”
